title: Caregiver, CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Smooth process and nice friendly people who interviewed me. the company is great with great benefits and they were knowledgeable in every aspect and answered all my questions. I was very impressed by the interview process.
Interview Questions: what made me choose their company

title: Materials Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Apply Recruiter will do a phone screening. Recruiter will then discuss with hiring manager Hiring manger or recruiter will call to set up interview If wanted for the position you will get a call with an offer If they are still interviewing they may set up a 2nd interview. Final decision then made. If they decide to go with another candidate then a rejection email will be received.
Interview Questions: Why are you wanting to work at JPS?

title: Account Receivable Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: I thought my in person interview went well. I was told that the next step was an interview with higher management after the holidays. Sent a thank you email for interview and no response. Called recruiter and they were unaware of what was going on after weeks had passed.
Interview Questions: All of the questions were behavioral questions.

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Very laid out and professional. Felt very welcomed and connected to the organization. They took interest in my life and wanted to really get to know me. They did take awhile to give denial letter.
Interview Questions: Why JPS and how would you fit into our culture?

title: Transition Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: I initially interviewed with the director and then after about 20-30 minutes met with two peers (I assumed were the team leads but both had been in the role 2+ years). Everyone was nice and made me feel comfortable. I interviewed midweek and had an answer two days later that I got the offer. Once accepted HR moved fast with getting the offer letter to me, getting the start date and all paperwork.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in a role? What do you see yourself doing in 5 years?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Really quick not a lot of face time. They only ask 3 questions that's it. So they decide quickly what they think about you. Be ready with answers. Their orientation is integrated with shift work. Starting pay nurse resident 30 an hour. Nice in person interviews
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you had a work conflict and how you resolved it?

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: contact recruiter and keep tabs with them. Interview with unit manager and hear back in a couple of days. Once a month they host orientation and you can start working after orientation.
Interview Questions: very specialized to unit but also general get to know you questions

title: Transition Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Job interview consists of meeting with the team lead and manager. After which will lead to a peer review which consists of 2-3 current Transition Coordinator. the final step will be a meeting with the Director. Each segment gives the interviewee the chance to ask questions in regards to the position and the team
Interview Questions: How do you handle crisis situation?

title: Manager Clinician Experience Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Great interview!  Very informative and I learned a lot about the job and met some great people! JPS is a great place to work! I would highly recommend working here.
Interview Questions: How would you work with an upset patient?

title: Talent Acquisition Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions:
I was called for a prescreening  with one of the Talent Consultants and afterwards a panel interview was scheduled via MS Teams.

There was a panel interview of 8 women all in the Talent Acquisition Department. Only about 5 of them asked questions and only about 2 asked more than 2 questions. No more than about 20-30 minutes. Was advised they had more interviews to conduct and would be able about a week before they made decisions. Was called back a little after a week (maybe about a week and a half) and extended an offer. Had to do a reference check, background screening, drug test and blood draw after accepting offer.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for JPS?

title: Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: interview was quickly scheduled and easy. It was group as well and just to get to know your knowledge and experience. For the most part went well and quick. Had some questions related to description and what duties helad before
Interview Questions: It was group interview and easy.

title: Patient Safety Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process was not bad however almost everything I was told was not correct. Did not get what I was told I would in the interview. The bonuses were not as I was told. The hours were not as I was told. And the list goes on. Just beware and do not believe all that is said.  And HR just say oh well..just a misunderstanding.
Interview Questions:
Typical interview questions..no surprises. 
Lasted maybe 15 minutes

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Talent Acquisition called me to set up Interview with Clinic Manager. After I finished my interview with the Manager she brought in the Team Lead. She only asked me a couple of questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Tell me about your previous Medical Assistant job.

title: Facilities Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Basic 2 part interview scheduled back to back. The bad part came after. I was offered the job, went through multiple blood draws, vaccinations, only to be totally ghosted by this company after my start date was pushed back three times
Interview Questions: Normal behavioral type questions. Not difficult

title: Patient Access Representative Call Center Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very brief, didn’t ask much. They needed help badly. Always hiring. If you get an interview you have the job trust me. Good luck. You’ve got this.
Interview Questions: Do I feel comfortable talking to difficult patients.

title: HR Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: A quick assessment after the application was requested. Within a week received an email requesting an interview. 30 min interview via video call to get to know work background and role details. Nothing complicated, just wanted to know how experience is relevant to the role.
Interview Questions:
Are you comfortable with excel?
Describe your work experience?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Grand Prairie, TX)
Interview Descriptions:
Phone screen with the hiring manager, followed by a panel interview with the team reporting to the role
Was asked my availability for a Follow-up interview the next week with executive leadership. Never heard back. I followed up and was told they hired someone else.
Interview Questions:
How do you deal with conflict?
How do you support your staff?

title: COVID-19 Screener Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was easy and the recruiter was very professional and nice. I was offered  the job on the spot and accepted. Orientation was scheduled soon after and I started work a week later. It was a really easy and stress-free process.
Interview Questions: It was just a few questions about availability and pay.

title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: I was first called by HR for a pre screen and then a zoom interview that lasted about 20 minutes where most of the  questions were behavioral interview style questions. It was also a panel style discussion
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work at JPS

title: Controller/HRManager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Interviews with Hiring Decision Maker and interviews with the team members in a group setting (those you will manage).  This was my experience during an HR interview which may differ in other departments slightly
Interview Questions: What is your leadership style?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: There is first an interview with a panel of 12-15 people, one manager from each unit asking you different types a questions about where you graduated from, strengths/weaknesses, behavioral type of questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a conflict with a coworker and how did you handle it?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview was straightforward with typical nursing interview questions. Nothing too hard or unexpected. There was a recruiter present,  along with a member of the admin team. They each had a paper with a list of standard questions that they took turns asking.
Interview Questions: What are some things you expect from your employer.

title: Pt Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Phone and video interview. Not a lot of questions asked but basically about how you would deal with callers having s bad day.  Or how did you handle a situation in which s co worker did not go their job. Did you do it for them
Interview Questions: How would you handle someone upset about a payment

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Waited in the lobby for my interviewer to take me back to a conference room. Was explained the interview process, score card for responses, etc. Asked behavioral style questions-- "how" and "why" questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you helped/supported a coworker through a difficult situation?

title: Case Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Arlington, TX) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Virtual and not coordinated well. I was sent the invitation which was changed multiple times. I also was not provided any follow up communication after the interview. They give you a personality assessment and you really need to just tell them you’re independent and thrive in the chaos. They probably want to hear that you take direction well, but you can also work independently
Interview Questions: What kind of environment do you want to work in.  How do you handle stress?

title: Diagnostic Medical Sonographer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: I came in early, so they took me back for the interview early. They were extremely kind and made me feel at ease. I sat down with the manager and the director. The sit-down interview was probably 20 minutes and then they took me back to scan for them. The scanning interview was very quick; they had me locate the pancreas, MPV and CBD. I'm still waiting on their response on whether I got the job or not.
Interview Questions: What do you want to see in your supervisor?

title: Graduate Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, had an initial interview, then an interview with the unit education manager and a current bedside nurse.  The initial interview was mostly behavioral questions which like 4 different interviewers. The 2nd interview was just the manager and bedside nurse and they were more specific questions related to how I learn best, and related to why I wanted to work in that unit.
Interview Questions: How have you handled conflict with a coworker?

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Don't even bother with this place unless you like throwing away time on one of those psychological assessments that are designed to rule you out for the job. Just another company basing its hiring decisions off some psychologists' ruse about what the perfect human is and how to destroy everyone else's life in the process. I sorely regret spending a moment of my precious time here, and so will you after 45 minutes of garbage questions about whether you get irritated by somebody sometimes or if you would get irritated if your boyfriend or girlfriend broke up with you.
Interview Questions: Ridiculous behavioral questions to weed out perfectly qualified candidates.

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted 1 week after applying. Was supposed to be 2 interviews in the same day but ended up having to go in 2 separate days. After my second interview the manager told me to contact her if I didn't hear anything back within a week (so I did) and got an automatic message back saying the manager was out of office.  So I contacted again once they were back in office and I was told that I would be contacted with a final decision the next day. Three days later I received an automated email telling me I didn't get the job. Overall it was a bit frustrating
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to work in a group

title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Received an email to schedule in person interview with unit manager. Then had an on the sport panel interview the same day! Process was super easy, efficient & I enjoyed it!
Interview Questions: Why JPS?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: My recruiter contacted me within two weeks of submitting my application. I had the opportunity to interview with 6 JPS clinics who had openings. Two weeks after that I was called forca second interview and recieved an offer letter about 10 days after.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for JPS?

title: Outpatient Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Easy, had a phone call, went in for a interview with a coding manager at a outpatient womens health center clinic in which was the clinic I was going to be coding for.  It was a very easy interview process, and probably took about 3 weeks or so before I started my on boarding process.
Interview Questions: What was my background

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Original phone interview was okay, second interview was spot on- I interviewed in person with the head of finance and my direct ED manager. However, I firmly believe the compensation discussion should happen from the get go (but the HR rep at the time said they don't discuss that until the second interview- [which now I know isn't true, but that's more on me])
Interview Questions: How do I deal with a difficult patient/situation?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a long process with a short interview.  The phone screen was easy and the in person interview was easy. Everyone was very nice. It took a while after applying to get a phone interview and then about 2 weeks to get an in person interview.
Interview Questions: Name a situation where you had to make a decision and what was the effect.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
Received call from HR 3 weeks after submitting application and answered some behavioral questions and interview with manager was scheduled


Went on interview with manager and 2 other nurses (not given any titles). Was asked broad questions about previous employer. I was given a paper and had to identify EKG rhythms. Was given 2 typed out scenarios and asked what I thought the diagnosis was and what I expected the doctor to order.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for JPS?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Got a call a couple days after application was put in, went in for an interview a week later, and once I left got a call from HR that I was offered the job position,
Interview Questions: What do you see in a leader?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: group interview, job fair type interview, 20 girls at one time, interview lasted about 15 mins you know right then if you make it to the next level call me 10 days after i applied
Interview Questions: what are my weaknesses?

title: ER Technician Level II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Received a Phone interview with a week of submitting my application. Then approximately a week later I was  interviewed by a team of seven in a single interview. I received an offer that day and I excepted. Approximately two weeks later I began with an indoctrination class for the hospital.
Interview Questions: Have you ever started an IV lines?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was an HR interview in an open hiring event. The HR team was very friendly and make you feel comfortable to answer the question. They listened to you very well and make a note on the needed answer they are searching for.
Interview Questions: what do you solve the conflict with your coworker?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX)
Interview Descriptions: To many people they interviewed in one day.  Only spent 10 minutes,  very rushed during the interview.  Never meet the person I was supposing to interview only the staff.  Automatically new I didn’t get the job watching them interview one person from a room all laughter.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation with a coworker.

title: Certified Medical Coder I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: After applying online, I received an email asking when I would like to schedule a phone interview. Set up for two days later. Then the recruiter called at the time we had scheduled.
Interview Questions: What interests you in working for JPS?

title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Room Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Professional and Efficient HR and Nursing Management Team. Very laid-back and informal. I applied online on a Wednesday, phone screened on Thursday, and interviewed in-person on the following Tuesday and received a job offer 2 hours later via telephone from the recruiter.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a situation you encountered with a difficult patient or co-worker.

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took 3 weeks. I completed the application online and was contacted the following day to schedule a phone interview.  After my phone interview, I was asked to schedule a one on one interview with the hiring manager the following week. The week after that, I was contacted by HR with and offer which I accepted.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work for JPS?

title: Clinical Laboratory Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: I applied online on 3/20, I was then contacted by email on 3/21 asking me what the best days/times were for a quick phone interview and then I had the phone interview on 3/22.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to apply to JPS?

title: RN, Bsn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screen followed by one-on-one interview followed by group interview—all on different days.  The group interview started almost an hour late due to a panel member being “detained on the floor.”  Once the interview commenced, I was never asked questions about how I would handle day-to-day likely scenarios but was asked what I do for fun, why I wanted to relocate to Ft Worth, whether I knew any current or former JPS employees, whether I had a bias against providing services to indigent patients, what nursing in the Air Force was like, etc.  My third and final  interview lasted 15-20 minutes.  Less than two hours later, I received an email that I was not a match for their organization.
Interview Questions: Do you know anyone who works in this department?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I was called two days after putting in an online application by recruiter. The interview was in person with the hiring manager, and floor manager. After that I had a standard peer interview with other social workers in the unit. It was very organic and open. Everyone I met was nice. I was called to a second after a week to meet with another unit. I thought I had the job but they called and said they decided to hire within.
Interview Questions:
Why JPS?
What do you know about us?
How do you handle conflict?

title: Patient Access Representative ER Weekend Nights Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online 12/18/17. Emailed about doing a phone interview on 12/19/17. Phone interview on 12/20/17. Scheduled face 2 face interview with Department Manager and Team Lead on 01/02/18. Department manager called with a non formal job offer on 01/05/18. HR called with a formal job offer on 01/08/18.
Interview Questions: What interests you about this position?

title: HR Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online and also sent my resume through a friend who works in a closely related department.  I was called a day later for a phone interview to screen for "fit" and scheduled for an interview the following week.
The interview panel of three Consultants asked mundane questions and seemed thoroughly disinterested.  They seemed like they were just 'going through the motions', and already decided to hire someone else before my interview. Each Consultant asked three or four 'bundled' questions with multiple parts to answer. I don't think they really put any effort into coming up with quality questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in healthcare?

title: Medical Resident Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Dallas, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I initially was intoduced to the medical residents over and informal dinner and the next day we were given the your of the hospital and later on we  had 4 interviews which was exhausting since the interviews start really late that is by 4 pm and we are there from 8 am
Interview Questions: Why have you chosen this speciallty?

title: Multimedia Content Producer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: I was initially contacted by HR to come in for an interview. I met with 2 of the leaders from the marketing department. It was a casual interview with basic questions like "tell us about yourself." I don't have anything negative to say about the interview process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at JPS?

title: Team Lead Sterile Processing Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a bit unorganized questioning had little to nothing to do with Sterile Processing was not real sure of the dynamics of the department was interviewed by the secretary 4 SPD techs can’t remember anyone asking me of my knowledge and years of experience majority of the questions were where else do you work and how many children do you have are you married but in the end I got the job and after only 3 weeks I had enough the management was horrible
Interview Questions: Where else do I work

title: Material Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: First, they call and schedule the interview. Usually, you have to make it through 2 interviews where they ask about experience, goals, education, and what you can offer the company; the norm. Then, if hired, the drug test must be passed but they gave it at the hospital rather than sending the applicant elsewhere.
Interview Questions: What can you offer this company? What made you apply here? What are you hoping to accomplish by working here?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: hi I applied for a registered nurse at JPS hospital in med-surgical. I applied on Saturday and they called me on Monday. that was very quick. Recuriter emailed me and want to set up an phone interview for 15-20 minutes. tried to email her back but its undeliverable. wait for 2 days.. but no response.. then I called the hospital and get touch with the recruiter. she interviewed me and then she said she will ask the manager to interview me. well she emailed me again with the time and date. its scheduled for Friday at 06:30 am.. early morning. well I went for an interview and she was in her office and arranging some papers. I introduced myself. she started questioning me. she asked me about the blood sugar questions.. and positive and negative experiences and lot of more questions. almost It went well. then I went back to my work and on same evening recruiter called me back and she left a voice mail stating that the manager interested in me and they wanna hire me. this was the most happiest day of my life. and I am really happy that am going to start working for a county hospital. that's it.. that's my story. wish u luck future nurses. interview is average and its not hard at all
Interview Questions:
about blood sugar questions
positive experiences
negative experiences

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at JPS Health Network in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I met a recruiter at a job fair on Tuesday, applied for the Job on that day. I received a call Thursday, interview the following Monday. Got offered the job several hours after the interview. Negotiated salary the same day and got my acceptance letter the following day (Tuesday). Everything happened within a week for me and I am so thankful because I know everyone has different experiences but mine was a very smooth transition.
Interview Questions: My biggest obstacle since being a nurse.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: You send your resume, then you will have a phone interview followed by 1:1 interview, often a table of peers to review and inquire/questions then again with manager or director
Interview Questions: Do you Ave a problem with caring for the poor and underserved population

title: Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Dont apply hear lady that interview pays more attention to her coffee than the candidate and she is very wack we in a room full of people and talking low so how can i hear the lady then hand her my resume she turned the resume around didnt even look at it.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: There were two interviews. The first interview was a panel with about 5-6 different managers. The second interview was a peer interview with two Registered Nurses, The first interview was little intense given the fact that it was a panel of people. They asked the basic "tell me about yourself" questions and "tell me about a time" along with conflict resolution questions. I was also asked about different dx and medications needed to treat them. The peer interview were basic questions along the lines of "why do you want to work here".
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you went above and beyond for a patient?

title: Medical Laboratory Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I met with the operations manager, the section manager and a bench tech. Everyone introduced themselves and explained their role in the lab. Then we delved into the interview. The whole process took close to an hour.
Interview Questions: Lots of behavioral type questions. (i.e. how would you handle a conflict with a coworker, or customer, etc.) A few micro questions were asked since I had no prev. work experience.

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed in the evening, one on one with manager.  Contacted the same week with a job offer. Scheduled health screenings and orientation, which took about a week to complete and reported to my department the following week for training.
Interview Questions: Have i interviewed with other departments.

title: Enrollment and Eligibility Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online on 10/05, HR contacted me on 10/10 to do a phone screen interview. He stated he would forward my application to the hiring manager(s). Didn't hear anything until again until 10/31, when HR called to schedule interview. Interviewed on 11/02, with two managers, one male and one female. Very nice and went over the day to day duties of the position and what was expected. I came prepared with some questions and information I had researched about the department online, which seemed to impress. Asked your typical behavioral and situational questions and scenarios. Interviewed on 11/02 (Wednesday) and had to wait about a week as they had interviews scheduled until Wednesday (11/09) of this week and would make a decision after all interviews were completed. I wrote a previous review and stated that I would update once I received a decision, but unfortunately, I was not able to update that review. So I am writing another one to update as I did receive a call this morning (11/11/2016) with an offer and a start date of 11/21/16--pending that the background, drug test and reference checks all work out (which they should, as it has never been an issue before). Was expecting a little bit higher in regards to pay, but it didn't seem to really be negotiable.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Arlington, TX) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: It is an unexpected panel interview by 4 RNs who have a series of various questions to ask you. They write as you go on about each reply you give them
Interview Questions: Nothing about the company.  Strictly about you as a person and what would you do in various situations.

title: Psych Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, next in person interview. There is a panel of people that interview. Bring resumes and come prepared! Each person on the panel will ask different questions. They also will expect you to ask some questions as well.
Interview Questions: What is something you have done for a client that was "over the top"?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very straight forward.  It did include completing an online assessment, phone or in-person interview, and a second interview with several members of the leadership/peers of the team.  Very friendly environment which was expected from a healthcare service provider.
Interview Questions: Basic questions about the candidates background and experience.  Very few situational questions.

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I was interviewed by both Leads and PIC then given a tour. It was very fast paced but open to questions. It was a little chaotic but still controlled. I learned a lot about the then process on how RXs were taken and then filled. It was a tad bit intimidating but I was also young and new to the field.
Interview Questions: What are you customer service skills?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was easy, typical office questions, culture and work ethnics, do I prefer to work in a team or individually. How do I believe I cope under pressure. Explain a time when you had to be late from work and how do you make up the work.
Interview Questions: What are your expectations of your team mates as it relates to communication and job share.

title: RN II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and recieved a phone call for face to face interview. The interviewers were very friendly and the whole process was easy. Behavioral type of questions were asked. Background screening was done. Was offered a job and started the job about a month later
Interview Questions: What would your former supervisor say about you

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Euless, TX) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was called for a phone interview . I was called and asked the basic interview questions. It went well and the interviewer promised to contact me within 48 to let me know if I got the job or if they selected a different candidate. 48 hours ended up on a Saturday so I'm hopeful I'll be contact by Tuesday because Monday is a holiday.
Interview Questions: Personal goals?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online on a Monday, and they called me on Wednesday for a phone interview. It went well to the best of my knowledge. She told be that she would forward my interview screening to her director/manager. She called me on today, Friday, just to confirm what position I was applying for (I had applied to several MA positions, prn and full time). I confirmed that I was applying for the full time position, which is the position she interviewed me for. No offer (yet?!?!!). Hoping for another call back!!
Interview Questions: What was my biggest pet peeve

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied on 12/30/2015, they contacted me in the middle of Jan, and I start on Feb 15. Hiring Process was kinda long but worth it. Had a phone interview, then a face to face, a second face to face the same day. They then sent me an assessment. I did the assessment which was a typing test, after I passed a few days later I got the offer of employment.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult time you had with a customer and how were you able to overcome it?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: It can be very hard to get an initial interview unless you already know someone who works there. There are many stages to the interview process.  Set you expectations according.
Interview Questions: Standard open ended questions about how you handled situations in the past.

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Arlington, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Good and very professional. Very informative about the job. Pleasant company and very friendly workers. Person doing the interview was very good at asking about work history. Made a job offer the same day.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a patient was upset?

title: EKG Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: They were very nice and professional The waiting period was not long and Jordan was real nice and explain about the hiring process and that I will get a call. I hope they call me because it is the number one hospital to work and train in the medical field.
Interview Questions: What was my goals

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was pretty straightforward.  I was put at ease from the start and asked questions about my work history and family life.  I was called and a date was set up for me to come in and interview with the manager.  I met with the manager, assistant manager, and another clerk who worked there.  The two managers had lots of questions regarding my background and qualifications.
Interview Questions: I was given a certain scenario and asked how I would handle it.

title: Respiratory Therapists Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy interview because they are desperate for employees and do not treat their employees well so please stay away unless you just want a pay check without job satisfaction. The director interviews everyone and then the recruiter will call you with an offer.
Interview Questions: Behavioral interview based questions

title: PATIENT EDUCATION COORDINATOR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a positive experience. The questions were fair. I was questioned about my past work experiences and reviewed my sample works. I was asked on how I would contribute to the current work process for the position I was applying for. Overall, it was a wonderful interview.
Interview Questions: questions about my experience

title: Director of Voulunteer Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process was quick as they were looking to hire immediately. It took less than two weeks from start to finish. A recruiter called me to perform a phone interview.  Four days later I was called in for an In-person interview. Then two days later a second interview.
Interview Questions: How many volunteers have I supervised on a daily basis.

title: Psych Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: You're in a room with three nurses and they ask you about yourself. They ask about your past work history and why you want to work with this company. They may ask you questions to see if you are truthful in your resume for example they were asking me dates of my employment and the names of my past mangers and how the transition in this field came into my mind.
Interview Questions: what would you do in a situation where someone is mad

title: Psych Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and had to complete a skills assessment. A few days later I received a phone call for aface to face interview, Had a panel interview with different managers. I was offered the job the week after via phone call.
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked in Psych before?

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, did a job assessment. Next day the hiring manager wanted to do a phone screen with me. Missed their call so the next day when I called them back they conducted the phone screen right away. They wanted to bring me in for an interview for the next day. The recruiter got in contact with me to set up the conformation email and to do Skill Testing. The next day I interviewed with the department. Everyone was very nice. They told me about the department what it would entail and what I would do. That they would train me etc. It felt more like a conversation rather than an interview. The hiring manager gave me their business card and told me that they would definitely have their HR team reach out to me. I emailed them a simple thank-you note. They replied and told me that they appreciate it and that they would tell me their final decision after they interviewed their last candidate. Sadly I did not get the job and I found out by checking the status online. No email. Overall the process was fast.
Interview Questions: Are you a team-player?

title: Medical Technologist PRN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: About 2 weeks after applying HR called to set up an interview the very next day. I was only available early morning seeing that I have a real job and she gave me a date 2 weeks later. When I arrived, there was a job fair and the recruiter didn't bother to meet with me like the HR person said would happen. The manager over the lab had to walk over to interview me. She didn't even introduce herself, she only complained about having to walk over in the cold, extremely light snow. Once the elevator ride downstairs and more complaining we made it to an office where she then proceeded to tell me the other manager was in a meeting and was not coming like he was supposed to. During the interview the questions were decently boring typical questions but I guess she didn't have her coffee bc i could see her falling asleep to my very short answers, as I'm not much of a talker i cut to the chase. After walking out i pretty much knew that I didn't get the job immediately.  I realized it wasn't me and that she was just a horrible person the very next week when I interviewed and pretty much was told I had the job on the spot.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time your work schedule conflicted with your personal schedule and how did you handle that?

title: Phlebotomy Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I wen in the office and met with an HR assistant,she interviewed me on spot and scheduled for a skill interview.I went there and did my skills test and said they will call me.After a week they called to offer me a job.
Interview Questions: general questions

title: Lactation Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via email first to set up a time to discuss the job.  2 days later I was called and "screened" by HR, which was really a phone interview.  I went in for an in person interview 3 days later with the manager, a couple staff members and project manager. I was offered a job 2 days later via phone.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a situation in which you did not agree with the MD about a care plan.

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job online.  Within 2 weeks, I received a call from the HR recruiter to schedule an interview for the following week.  Everyone I met was very friendly and professional, and I really liked the feel of the environment there.  Unfortunately, I did not get the position.
Interview Questions: The standard questions. Nothing too difficult.

title: Contract Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume and in a week or so, HR contacted me and suggested I apply for this position. I did and had a Skype interview, followed by a trip to Ft Worth for 4 interviews in one day. They paid for my travel.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions. Nothing out of the ordinary.

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at JPS Health Network
Interview Descriptions: I was initially called by one of the hiring recruiters to set up an interview. The interview was set up within 3-4 days and lasted about 30 minutes. I was called the next day for references and background check and then the day after that was called again with an offer. The entire process did not take long at all.
Interview Questions: I was actually expecting "what's your weakness" but never got asked that.

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job online.  The recruiter called me and an interview was set up for the next week.  It was a panel interview, but the recruiter did not inform me of the fact.  Apparently, I was being considered for several possible positions, when I had only applied for one.
Interview Questions: I was asked about how I work with people and what my preference were for a work environment.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Made it through 2 interviews. The first was a general interview and pretty informal--more like a personality check. The second interview was very short and straight to the point about which software I'd used and which techniques I have experience performing.
Interview Questions: General interview questions and pointed questions about experience with certain software and techniques

title: Client Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews and a phone interview.  the interview lasted about an hour with 2 people present and then the last interview was one on one. The process is tedious and lengthy.  Lots of questions were asked.
Interview Questions: how do you handle work stress

title: Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Have to have a cna liscence or they wont even consider you. They say they accept second year nursing students but often does not. So if you apply for this job at jps you have to have a cna or know someone who can get you in. You may be able to get prn but probably not
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for our company?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Went well I sat with 3 people for the interview process. They asked multiple questions regarding my character and love for patents and phlebotomy.  This had always been a dream job of mine and I applied for 4 years before actually being looked at. Was y what I thought it would be.
Interview Questions: Why do you feel that you’d be an asset to JPS

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: There was 1 week hospital orientation. Food was provided for free on 1 of the days. They went over tons of information about the hospital and health care.  There was  2 weeks training on site. we took computer classes and modules. All the staff was very helpful in answering questions.
Interview Questions: What is your weakness?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: met staff , manager, and tour of hospital, talked to each member of the unit I was assigned to. manager invited to have lunch and become more acquainted with staff
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an online app, received a phone call from recruiter...had an easy phone screen, got a phone call 2 days later from unit manager, interview set up...the interview was a lengthy peer interview with basic questions from lead nurses on the unit...nothing hard..then sat with the unit director for a few minutes. never got a call back...I thought the interview went well and they liked me on the unit...perhaps they thought I was a bit inexperienced. It was a Trauma/Surgical PCU position and they kept talking like it was the hardest job in the world lol...
Interview Questions: I always hate the "what is your biggest weakness" question...

title: Senior Performance Improvement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Aubrie, the SVP of Quality called my cell phone 3 hours after I applied, that was a first and a pleasant surprise. They flew me out for a full day interview with 6 team members. Put me in Hilton Garden, loved it. All expenses paid, except food. Took weeks before getting an offer. Seemed long, I called almost daily to check my status. I sent thank you notes to all and recommend you do the same. Offer came, with a start date and salary above what I expected, $107,000. I negotiated relocation, paid me 5k up front, which was much appreciated.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Describe a time you lead an improvement project, from beginning to end. How do you build teams. What statistical method is used when working with continuous data vs. counts. Strengths. Weaknesses. Greatest achievement. My passion and what drives me.

title: Data Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I sat at a table with several directors and was asked a series of questions. It was probably the most positive experience I had while working at JPS. They asked my skills, my willingness to work at JPS, and we had a nice conversation. It was very welcoming and friendly.
Interview Questions: The questions were very generic.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: HR contacted me to coordinate interview. They provided a list of interview days, which was helpful. HR was very professional and prompt to answer questions. There really wans't much more to the process, fairly straightforward.
Interview Questions: What would you do in a situation with an agitated patient?

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Washington, DC) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Walk in, get hired.
Interview Questions: Are you free to work nights?

title: RN - Ortho/Neuro Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: I received a call after applying online. An interview date was set. The actual interview was before a panel of 4 managers from different areas. They each had openings and wanted to see which area I would be a good fit for.
Interview Questions: What's your greatest weakness

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fine, duties, hours and pay explained. Orientation was long and lots of information not exactly. job-Specific. Its my understanding that the process has been updated and streamlined.
Interview Questions: Can you take pride in serving your community?

title: Referral Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at JPS Health Network in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was hired internally within my department. Since my supervisor was familiar with my work experience the process was easy. My previous work experience was used as a practical interview. However, my supervisor did sit down with me to discuss what I could add to this position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: You get an interview by phone first, then with the manager and doctors and meet the staff. During the phone interview, you are asked why you chose this hospital, skills review, and about salary. If they take the next step, the manager sets up a time to meet them, doctors, and staff. If all goes well, HR will call and give an offer along with final salary.
Interview Questions: What would you do if encountered a mean coworker who was like that almost everyday?

title: Access Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at JPS Health Network (Fort Worth, TX) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: First contact HR
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: RN II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at JPS Health Network in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: Submitted online application and received a call within 48 hours.  Completed a standard personality test online, and that took awhile.  Choose the best answer/how would you handle situation X, with "no wrong answers."  Had interview two days later, and hired on the spot.  For certain units it helps tremendously to know someone and put their name in the referral box.  You'll be working with these people daily and relying on each other, so personalities matter.
Interview Questions: There are standard clinical questions in the interview; however, it was a conversation, not a fill in the blank.  The usual questions were asked- difficult situations, how it was handled, previous working relationships with residents and physicians, etc.
